comments:
Drop a Shell on an empty file and drop a Button, Checkbox and a Table. Hit
revert and exceptions are thrown in the log and the remote VM crashes. Its
something about the diposing of beans on the remote VM - the image capture
mechanism seems to be missing some parent windows and hence crashes. 
After the recycling of the remote VM everything is back up again.

Created an attachment (id=20060)
Log of exceptions

This problem also occurs when one renames a variable - as it involves disposing
of beans and children etc.

Releasing native capture .so file and ControlManager.

Joe, currently the ControlManager on the remotevm *always* expects an image back
for a passed in control - irrespective of whether he/his parent are disposed or
not. This causes problems on the native capture stuff which I have fixed for
GTK, but the ControlManager needs to inform his peer on the IDE side that 'an
image capture has failed' or 'no image for this control' - something he doesnt do. 

For the time being i send back a dummy image of 1x1 of depth 2 to bypass the
NPEs - we need some additional notification mechanism between the IDE and remote
ControlManagers that an image capture has failed.

Leaving this defect open for fixing that problem.
Exceptions still occur in other cases of RCP Views - need to have a look again.
Exceptions in native code - need to have a look at it again.

Created an attachment (id=20295)
org.eclipse.ve.swt pluging patch

Jon, can you unzip the swt plugin on top of your image and verify.
tks
Opps, added the patch to the wrong Defect; intendent to Bug 92566

The bug title of this is more severe than it really appears.
Sri fixed the original problem but had to do so by making the ControlManager on
the target VM return a small image with a small depth that is the trigger to the
IDE that the capture failed.
A better fix would be to have some kind of opcode returned but I am loathe to do
this now for M1.2 given that ImageCapture is a very fragile area so I think I am
going to defer this to 1.1.  I will still work on a fix and we can make the call
later whether we want to include it in 1.2 or not.
As it currently stands there are no ill effects for the user - the user sees
nothing bad and this fix does not improve the user experience at all - it is
just a good diligent fix to do but not one we should hold up a build for.

Sri, we now do return a return code. Verify that this is still valid defect, or
that something else needs to be done, please.

No crashes etc. in M20050824. But the PS does throw a NPE when a revert is
performed. Moving it to 1.2 as it is not that serious.
